Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Entirety \En*tire"ty\, n.; pl. {Entireness}. [OF. entieret['e]. Cf. {Integrity}.] 1. The state of being entire; completeness; as, entirely of interest. --Blackstone. [1913 Webster]
2. That which is entire; the whole. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
entirety n : the state of being total; "appalled by the totality of the destruction" [syn: {entireness}, {totality}]
